alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 12:28AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Oldham and north central Deaf Smith Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1228 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Simms, or 15 miles southwest of Vega, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Oldham and north central Deaf Smith Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
